result.execSummary:
The defendant Marshall J Lock was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: All conditions of probation shall remain the same for Extended Supervision.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall submit to random drug screens including blood, breath or urine.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marshall J Lock

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Disposition Form
Letter received from Atty Cannon

Def in person & by Atty Gary R. Schmaus.  Atty Peter J. Cannon appeared for State.  Resolution reached; State moves to amend Ct. 1 to Possession of Schedule I or II Narcotic, Class I Felony, pursuant to sec. 961.41(3g)(am) and Court so orders.  Guilty plea entered on Ct. 1 as amended.  Court finds def guilty on Ct. 1 as amended.  Statements by counsel.  Statement by Defendant.  Court proceeds to sentencing.
Hearing on September 17, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Def in person & by Atty Gary R. Schmaus.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.   Offer rec'd and rev'd w/ def, Def scheduled to attend the Teen Challenge program.  Continued Arraignment scheduled for September 17, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Arraignment on September 3, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Def in person & by Atty Gary R. Schmaus.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper appeared for State.  Counsel's first appearance.  Arraignment scheduled for September 3, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Arraignment on July 31, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Def in person & by Atty Barbara J Privat.  Atty Sandra J Giernoth appeared for State.  Information filed and reading waived.  Adjourned to allow counsel to obtain treatment information and for additional investigation.  Arraignment continued.  Arraignment scheduled for July 31, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Letter received from Atty Giernoth
Arraignment on June 12, 2014 at 09:45 am.

Def in person & by Atty Barbara J Privat.  Atty Mark D Bensen appeared for State. Atty to investigate further. Def waives preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver and binds defendant over.  Arraignment scheduled for June 12, 2014 at 09:45 am.
Hearing on May 16, 2014 at 09:45 am.

Def in person & by Atty Barbara J. Privat.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth appeared for State.  Defendant missed court due to listing an incorrect time; Court withdraws stayed warrant.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for May 16, 2014 at 09:45 am.
CORRECTED NOTICE:  4-16-14 Hearing reset to 4-02-14 at 1:15 p.m.
Hearing on April 16, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Atty Barbara J. Privat appearing for Def.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper for State.  Counsel has been in contact with defendant.  Warrant and bail forfeiture issued and stayed until adjourned date.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing and for mandatory appearance by defendant.  Hearing scheduled for April 16, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription
Hearing on March 24, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Def appeared in person.  Atty Blaine Balow for State with Deputy DA Stephanie Hanson.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  $2,500 signature bond set.  Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  Defendant to consult with SPD and info. given.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing and to appear with counsel.  Hearing scheduled for March 24, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Initial appearance on March 3, 2014 at 09:45 am.
